intro: Riedelia officinalis, commonly known as the yellow lily of the valley, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in shaded, humid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Riedelia officinalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
